runs.comm: Swing and a miss to start off. It was full, it was outside off with a hint of movement away, Watson went for the big off drive but couldn't put wood on leather
closer to the off stump and Watson drives straight to mid-off
tries the slower one but ends up slipping it wide outside leg stump; Watson tried to have a crack at it but couldn't reach
Taylor and Sars remove Watto. It was full and just outside off and Watson went for his drive. He couldn't clear Sarwan at mid-off, though.
Boos ring out as Aleem Dar signals wide. It was the slower bouncer that looped past the batsman.
the outswinger this time but the left hand never kicked in the bowling action and he ended up spraying it wide outside off

Ponting is gone! Would you believe it? Two wickets in the over. What drama at The Oval. After couple of wides, Taylor got this one straight on the stumps. Ponting was on his typical forward lunge and couldn't get his bat around the front pad. Gone! Plumb in front. Dead duck.
slips in a slower one and on target too, rolls off the pad to the on side
what a gem to finish things off. The loopy slower bouncer, that T20 has really brought it in fashion, and Clarke hops before ducking and the ball loops past his head
full and well outside off, angling away, Warner can't reach it
on a length, around the off stump, almost 144 kmph and that hurries Warner who ends up jabbing it back down the pitch
143.6 kmph slinging full delivery outside off and Warner pushes at it with no foot movement and the ball rushes past the outside edge
142.3 kmph back of length delivery on the middle, tapped to the on side for a single. Free hit coming up.
clears the front foot and drags the ball to deep square leg
bursts up from back of length towards off and middle, flat-batted swipe sees the ball hit the stumps at the non-striker's end
140.2 kmph short in length delivery, curving past the off stump, past the outside edge and to the keeper
leans forward to play on the up but the ball bounces more than he thinks and he withdraws the bottom-hand off the handle in a hurry and pushes the ball away to the on side
from round the stumps to the left-hander, almost hits the blockhole, dug out back to the bowler
fullish, outside off stump, driven to covers
short in length, cut away to covers where X man (Xavier Marshall) makes a mess. perhaps, got a bad bounce there
Taylor keeps dishing out the slower bouncer. Again effective. The batsman had to wait and then adjust to the bounce and to the pace and he ended up dabbing it to midwicket

Oh dear! West Indies continue to make a mess on the field. This time it's Sarwan. It was pushed wide of him at mid-off for a single but he jogged across and let the ball through him! Ian Bishop is on air and he sighs....
starts the over with a bouncer over the leg stump, Clarke gets down under
145.9 kmph length delivery on the middle, Clarke is right behind it, trying to tap it to the on side for a possible single but ends up pushing it to the on side of the pitch and Fidel fields

Oh boy! the third wicket is down. What a start by the Windies. They might be fielding poorly but the bowling has been good. Clarke moved outside leg stump to go for the high-risk option of going over the off-side field. Fidel kicked it up from short of length and kept it just outside off, Clarke lunged out as he went for his cut. The edge flew straight to third man.
What a response from Warner! Stunning pull. Great to watch. Imperious. He rocked back early to pull the short delivery high over midwicket. It flew far.
Fidel cranks up the pace. almost 148 kmph. Short of length and rushing outside off stump. Warner tried to upper cut it but couldn't put bat to ball.
fuller, around 147 kmph, on the leg stump line, warner, who stays still and adjacent to the line usually, pushes it to the on side for a single
from round the stumps, fullish, on the pads, turned to the on side
lovely hit straight over the bowler's head. He leaned forward, picked the full length delivery and creamed it up and over.
still from round the stumps, angling in on the leg stump, Warner stays outside the line and pushes it back down the pitch
moves in towards the middle stump, slightly slower, Warner waits before punching it back to the bowler
133.5 length delivery around off stump, pushed towards cover point for a quick single
another slower one, full and on the middle, early into the stroke but the ball falls fell short of mid-on
146.8 kmph full and on the leg and middle, pushed towards wide mid-on for a single
Almost a six over third man. He backed away a touch to play the upper cut and it flashed to very fine third man
big swing and a miss. Again, he moved away a touch and tried to carve the length delivery over point
fuller, straighter, driven down to mid-on
full again, driven to left of mid-off and Sarwan makes a diving half-stop.
148.3 kmph , cutting towards off and middle, Warner defends it to the on side. End of Powerplays.
comes down the track but mistimes the shot to cover
again the intent is there as he charges out but Benn is getting it to dip nicely on him and he could only push it tamely to cover
worked through the on side this time
from over the wicket for Warner, who drives to long-on
stumping missed. Haddin was down the track and Benn slipped it cleverly down the leg side but Ramdin couldn't gather cleanly.
again nice bit of dip and Haddin lunges out to drive past cover
leans forward to pick a single with a drive to long-off

full pitched outside off stump, square driven to deep point where Fletcher makes a lovely mess of it. Oh dear. Poor fielding continues. He didn't pick it up cleanly and the ball popped out of his clutches and ran to the boundary!
driven to left of deep cover this time for couple of runs
leans forward to tap to the off side for a single
slower one, outside off, early into the shot and ends up dragging it to wide midwicket
steps down the track but Benn has bowled superbly so far, again gets it to dip quickly on Haddin who drags the lofted shot to wide long on
charges out again, and Benn slips in the quicker arm ball outside off, jabbed to point for a single
rolls off the pad to the on side
jumps out of the crease, Benn not only shortens the length but gets it to turn in and Warner stabs it to the off side
drifts towards the leg stump, beats the bat swing to hit the pad
slows up the pace as Haddin moves down the track and Haddin adjusts to tap it through cover
on the front foot, turns it to the leg side
slightly short in length, pulled away to deep square leg
tries to slip in the quicker one but drags it outside leg and Warner tickles it past the short fine-leg fielder
slower, on the middle and leg, pushed back to Gayle
slows up the pace further, outside off, cut away through backward point
fires in the yorker, dug out towards long-off
on the middle and leg, turning in, worked through backward square leg for couple of runs..
moves down the track, Benn shortens the length and Warner, who has just added 50 runs with Haddin, cuts it to deep backward point region
quicker, on the middle and leg, pushed to straightish midwicket
yorker outside off stump, Warner can't dig it out , misses but the ball tails past the off stump and bounds away for Ramdin's pad
Haddin, who has been repeatedly trying to get down the track, stays back this time and pulls a short delivery over midwicket for a big six...

What a delicious late steer! Catch it on the youtube. He moved fractionally outside leg, Benn fired it at the blockhole but just outside off, Haddin leaned back, opened the bat-face and ran it down superbly through vacant slip region. Fab shot.
mediumpace length delivery on the off stump, tapped through midwicket for a couple of runs
fuller, on the leg stump line, stops on the batsman, who checks his shot and it balloons over square leg
Full and on the stumps, Haddin goes for the big swing but ends up hitting it straight up and Benn gets under it at midwicket. Haddin falls after a little cameo.
on a length, on the middle, pushed back to the bowler
full again, driven to long-off for a single and that's his fifty. Well played Warner. The stunning pull off Fidel being the highlight.
slower one, just coming in from outside off, guided past backward point for a single
gets a single down to long-on
slows up the pace and Warner, looking to come down the track, is made to wait and he pushes it to mid-off region
flatter, outside off, pushed through cover point for a single
full, on the middle and off, driven past Gayle who dives full stretch to make the stop. Well done Cappo!
driven to wide long-on region for two more runs
drifts towards the pad, slightly slower through the air, Warner is early into the shot- he was looking for a tap to the on side to retain the strike - and the ball rolls away off the pad
slower one, on the middle and off, tapped to backward point
short and wide and Warner carves it over backward point without any fuss.
fuller and straighter, driven to long-off for a single
Top shot! Big big hit over long-off. So far, he was just looking for singles. Suddenly, this time, he got under the full delivery and murdered it high over long-off. Smooth clean hit.

beaten by the slower one. It was outside off, Hussey was on the lunge, trying to hold the balance and couldn't put bat to ball. Ramdin doesn't gather cleanly but Hussey's backfoot was inside the crease
quicker and this one bounces past the startled Hussey and to Ramdin
moves down the track and lofts to wide long-off
quicker, armball on the middle and off, chopped to short third man, could have been a risky single but Bravo doesn't pick it up cleanly
aha .. the long hop and Hussey puts it out of its misery. A big wallop and the ball screamed over midwicket boundary
charges down the track, goes for the big hit, edges it to short fine leg
low full toss, mistimed to covers
low dipping full toss, Warner lunges forward and some how gets it over the jumping Bravo
full toss, low outside off stump, carved away to long-off
another low dipping full toss outside off, Warner, again, lunged forward to drive but ended up slicing it to covers. A fine hand from him, though.
slower one but slips it down the leg side for a wide
Yet another slower one that goes awry
lovely on drive .. He leaned forward to flick it through wide midwicket and I thought ok there might be two in it but he had found the gap perfectly
despite those wides, he bravely goes for another slower one, dug back to Bravo and David dives to get back in his crease
another slower one, Michael is early into the shot and the ball rolls off the pad
full, drifting towards middle and leg, flicked away to deep square leg
the clever little slower one outside off, Hussey was so early into his shot that he completed the arc of the bat and the ball just passed the stumps
Whoa. Take that. David Hussey kills this one. It was full and it ended up over long-on. Clean full smooth swing of the bat.
pretty full, pushed out to the on side
slower one and the left-handed Hussey drag pulls it to deep midwicket
goes for the bouncer but it sails high over the batsman ... wide
driven to the on side for a single
slips down the leg side and Ramdin dives but cant' cover it ..
Dropped by Chanderpaul at long-on. What a dolly And what a mess. He took couple of steps forward and just froze. Not only did he drop but also gave away the four. Chanders wake up!
goes for the big hit , edges it to fine leg
Low full toss and David swings it high over midwicket. Fletcher is some where there. But the ball seems to be landing safely but Fletcher charged ahead, lunged forward to take a diving catch.
fullish, around off stump, driven well to long-off
driven to the on side for a single
superb slow bouncer and Michael is in all sort of tangle as he checks the pull shot, tries the dab shot and some how manages to put bat on ball in the end
driven through the off side, and there is a overthrow from Benn now .. oh what a mess of ground fielding today
the slower one and Mitchell is too early with the shot and the ball bounces over the middle
Another slower one but Mitch waits this time before lunging out to knife it to wide long-off boundary. Fine adjustment in the end by him
the slow bouncer and Mitchell taps it past square leg .... Taylor seems to have perfected the slow bouncer  ... very good control ...
Mitch holes out at long-on. He went for the big six over long-on but couldn't clear Bravo.
pretty full on stumps, pushed out to the off side for a single
yorker outside off stump, Brett Lee can only dig it out to the off side
fullish, on the middle stump line, dragged down to long-on region

dropped 'catch' plus palmed it over the boundary for a six. Xavier Marshall, the culprit. It was a high full toss and Hussey whacked it to deep midwicket where Marshall didn't judge it properly, threw in a dive and palmed it over for a six! No ball for the height.
goes for the yorker, Hussey went for the swipe to the on side and edged it past the short fine-leg fielder
another very full delivery, Hussey drags it to the on side for a single.
